Your event management website is ready to deploy! Here are the **easiest ways** to share it with your employees:

## âš¡ **OPTION 1: GitHub Pages (FREE & RECOMMENDED)**

### Steps:
1. **Create a GitHub account** (if you don't have one):
   - Go to https://github.com/signup
   - Sign up for free

2. **Create a new repository**:
   - Click the "+" icon â†’ "New repository"
   - Name it: `event-management`
   - Make it **Public**
   - Click "Create repository"

3. **Upload your files**:
   - Click "uploading an existing file"
   - Drag and drop these files:
     - `index.html`
     - `styles.css`
     - `script.js`
   - Click "Commit changes"

4. **Enable GitHub Pages**:
   - Go to Settings â†’ Pages
   - Under "Source", select "main" branch
   - Click "Save"
   - Your site will be live at: `https://YOUR-USERNAME.github.io/event-management/`

**âœ… Result**: Your employees can access it at the GitHub Pages URL!

---

## âš¡ **OPTION 2: Netlify (FREE & INSTANT)**

### Steps:
1. **Go to Netlify**:
   - Visit https://www.netlify.com/
   - Click "Sign up" (use GitHub, Google, or email)

2. **Deploy your site**:
   - Click "Add new site" â†’ "Deploy manually"
   - Drag and drop the entire `e:\projects` folder
   - Wait 30 seconds for deployment

3. **Get your link**:
   - Netlify will give you a URL like: `https://random-name-123.netlify.app`
   - You can customize this to: `https://your-company-events.netlify.app`

**âœ… Result**: Instant online link, no coding required!

---

## âš¡ **OPTION 3: Vercel (FREE & FAST)**

### Steps:
1. **Go to Vercel**:
   - Visit https://vercel.com/
   - Click "Sign up" (use GitHub, GitLab, or email)

2. **Deploy**:
   - Click "Add New" â†’ "Project"
   - Click "Deploy" â†’ Drag your project folder
   - Get instant URL: `https://your-project.vercel.app`

**âœ… Result**: Professional hosting with custom domain support!

---

## âš¡ **OPTION 4: Render (FREE)**

### Steps:
1. Visit https://render.com/
2. Sign up for free
3. Click "New Static Site"
4. Connect your GitHub repo or upload files
5. Get your URL: `https://your-site.onrender.com`

---

## âš¡ **OPTION 5: InfinityFree (FREE Hosting with Custom Domain)**

### Steps:
1. Visit https://www.infinityfree.net/
2. Sign up and create a free account
3. Upload files via File Manager or FTP
4. Get a free subdomain or connect your own domain
